monster.name: Dart Slipfoot
monster.skill: Animal Handling +5, Deception +3, Investigation +5, Stealth +6, Survival +5

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Has advantage on saving throws against being charmed. Magic can't put Dart to sleep.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
trait.text: Humanoids (elves, dwarves, halflings, humans): Dart has advantage on Wisdom (survival) checks to track his favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Favored Terrain
trait.text: Dart isn't hindered at all when traversing through the Candle Marsh, Fort Strade, or Strade's Gallows.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Dart is an 4th level spellcaster, his spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He requires material components to cast spells. Dart has the following ranger spells prepared:
• 1st level (4 slots): alarm, animal friendship, longstrider • 2nd level (3 slots): locate object, pass without trace

action.name: Extra Attack
action.text: Dart can attack twice instead of attacking once during his turn.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit 2 (1d4+3) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit 8 (1d8+3) piercing damage.

monster.spells: alarm, animal friendship, longstrider, locate object, pass without trace
monster.description:
Gear: Explorer's pack, 2 daggers, longbow, scale mail, spell component pouch, Watch uniform, 200 gp.
Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Edgar Windhowler
monster.skill: Acrobatics +6, Deception +7, Insight +3, Performance +10, Persuasion +10, Sleight Of Hand +6

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Lucky
trait.text: When Edgar rolls a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die, using the new roll.

trait.name: Rakish Demeanor
trait.text: Advantage on Charisma skill rolls against female characters.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Edgar is an 8th level spellcaster, his spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He requires material components to cast spells. Edgar has the following bard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): friends, light, mage hand, vicious mockery • 1st level (4 slots): charm person, cure wounds, disguise self, identify, Tasha's hideous laughter • 2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, blur, heat metal, zone of truth • 3rd level (3 slots): fear, hypnotic pattern • 4th level (2 slots): confusion

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5ft. one target. Hit 2 (1d8+3) piercing damage.

monster.spells: friends, light, mage hand, vicious mockery, charm person, cure wounds, disguise self, identify, Tasha's hideous laughter, blindness/deafness, blur, heat metal, zone of truth, fear, hypnotic pattern, confusion
monster.description:
Gear: Entertainer's pack, flute, rapier, spell component pouch, studded leather armor, Watch uniform, 200gp.
Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Floopdoogle

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The Terrible Floopdoogle can hold its breath for 25 minutes.

trait.name: Rake
trait.text: If The Terrible Floopdoogle successfully grapples a creature with its bite attack, it can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Floopdoogle Reincarnate
trait.text:
When The Terrible Floopdoogle is slain, the creature killing it will become the new deity worshipped by the kuo-toa. The creature will begin exhibiting new features, as seen here:
• Day 1: Understands undercommon but does not speak it. • Day 2: Skin becomes crustacean-like (+1 AC). • Day 3: Eyes elongate into stalks (+2 on Perception checks). • Day 4: Fully speaks undercommon and skin becomes more crustacean-like (additional +1 AC). • Day 5: Body begins to smell and feel like fish. (disadvantage on all Charisma checks made against "civilized" people.) • Day 6: Can breathe water and air and gains swim 30ft. • Day 7: Hands become like lobster pincers (gains a claws melee weapon attack with d6 slashing damage.) Gains aberration as a creature subtype

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing magical damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit. Reach 5ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Fortin Harra

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
trait.text: When reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, Fortin drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Savage Attacks
trait.text: When Fortin scores a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, he can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Fortin is an 8th level spellcaster, his spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +6 to hit with spell attacks). He requires material components to cast spells. Fortin has the following sorcerer spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, light, mage hand, message, true strike • 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, hold person, suggestion • 3rd level (3 slots): blink, dispel magic • 4th level (2 slots): greater invisibility

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d8+1) slashing damage or 6 (1d10+1) when using two hands.

monster.spells: dancing lights, light, mage hand, message, true strike, detect magic, magic missile, thunderwave, detect thoughts, hold person, suggestion, blink, dispel magic, greater invisibility
monster.description:
Gear: Burglar's pack, caltrops, longsword, scale mail, shield, spell component pouch, Watch uniform, 400gp.
Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Lank
monster.skill: Acrobatics +6, Deception +7, Insight +3, Performance +10, Persuasion +10, Sleight Of Hand +6

trait.name: Feral Instinct
trait.text: Lank has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Frenzy
trait.text: When raging, Lank can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of his turns after the turn he rages on.

trait.name: Mindless Rage
trait.text: Lank can't be charmed or frightened while raging.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: Lank can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

trait.name: Rage (4/Day)
trait.text:
On Lank's turn, he may enter a rage as a bonus action. Raging lasts for 1 minute, but ends early if Lank is knocked unconscious or if his turn ends and he hasn't attacked a hostile creature since his last turn or taken damage gaining the following advantages:
• Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. • +2 extra damage on melee weapon attacks. • Resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Lank is not wearing any armor, his armor class equals his 10 + his Dexterity modifier + his Constitution modifier.

action.name: Extra Attack
action.text: Lank can attack twice instead of attacking once during his turn.

action.name: Battleaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5ft. or one target. Hit 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage or 8 (1d10+3) slashing damage when using two hands.

monster.description:
Gear: Battleaxe, explorer's pack, Watch uniform, 100 gp.
Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Margot, The Fey Fettered

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Margot's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). Margot can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: bestow curse, darkness, fear, fireball, magic missile, shatter, sleet storm • 1/Day each: control weather, insect plague

trait.name: Whirling Chains
trait.text: The mass of chains descending from Margot give her +2 to AC when she's flying.

action.name: Chain Swipe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack. +4 to hit, reach 30ft., one creature. 10 (2d8+1) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: bestow curse, darkness, fear, fireball, magic missile, shatter, sleet storm, control weather, insect plague
monster.description: Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Rosalynn, The Dirge of a Thousand Weepings

trait.name: Allergy: Rosewhistle
trait.text: Rosalynn is allergic to rosewhistle flowers and has disadvantages on attacks against any creature carrying rosewhistle or under the influence of a rosewhistle tincture. Also, creatures carrying rosewhistle or under the influence of a rosewhistle tincture have advantage on saves against Rosalynn's abilities.

trait.name: Cerebral Bite (1/Day)
trait.text: Rosalynn can cast weird at a save DC of 14, but no psychic damage is dealt by the spell.

trait.name: Song of Rosalynn
trait.text: A creature that begins its turn within 5 feet of Rosalynn must pass a Charisma save DC 14 or suffer 1 level of exhaustion.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack. +5 to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. Hit 21 (4d8+2) piercing damage. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into Rosalynn.

legendary.name: Lair Actions
legendary.text:
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Rosalynn takes a lair action to cause the following effect:
• Haunting Echoes. Rosalynn delves into a creature's mind and warps the reality around her into a pocket dimension. The pocket dimension is a copy of a location in the creature's past, typically a childhood place of peace. Any other nearby creatures are pulled into the location as well. While in this world, Rosalynn can freely cast major image. Also, Rosalynn can cast meld into stone on herself, allowing her to move through any terrain in this world. If the major image reacts with a PC or if Rosalynn approaches a PC while merged, the PC can make a Wisdom (Insight) check DC 14 to determine the false illusions.

monster.description: Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)

monster.name: Shae, The Half-Hag

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Shae's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12). Shae can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: mage hand, shillelagh, thorn whip • 3/Day: goodberry, magic missile • 1/Day: gust of wind

trait.name: Muddled Mentality
trait.text: If Rosalynn, the Dirge of a Thousand Weepings is alive, roll 1d6 every hour that Shae is awake. On a 1, Shae's alignment changes to chaotic evil for 1 hour.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. Hit 4 (1d6+1) piercing damage.

action.name: Shillelagh
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack. +4 to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. Hit 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning magic damage.

monster.spells: mage hand, shillelagh, thorn whip, goodberry, magic missile, gust of wind
monster.description:
Gear: Crossbow bolts (20), dagger, explorer's pack, hand crossbow, potion of healing, quarterstaff, set of traveler's clothes, studded leather armor.
Source: Remley Farr - Fishing for Gods in Strade's Gallows (Homebrew)
